intro: Eriocaulon quinquangulare subsp. quinquangulare, commonly known as the five-angled spikerush, is a member of the Poaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or aquatic environments, such as marshes and swampy areas. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinct five-angled cross-section, which is a key identifying feature. The species is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is adapted to humid, nutrient-rich soils.
